summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from June 25, 2019, discussing victim notification procedures in anticipation of an upcoming arrest in the Jeffrey Epstein case. It reveals coordination between the FBI's New York office and the SDNY (Southern District of New York) to compile and manage victim information for rights notification.

persons.name: Olsen
persons.context: Mentioned as having discussed the case with an FBI agent; part of the SDNY team coordinating victim information.

events.title: FBI Email Coordination on Epstein Victim Notification
events.description: Internal FBI emails discuss procedures for handling victim information in anticipation of an upcoming arrest in the Epstein case, including plans for a press release and victim hotline.

events.title: Planned Arrest and Victim Outreach
events.description: The emails reference an 'upcoming arrest' (presumably of Jeffrey Epstein) and detail plans for the SDNY to issue a press release and establish an 800 number for victims to self-identify after the arrest.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively preparing for an 'upcoming arrest' in the Jeffrey Epstein case as of June 25, 2019.
The Southern District of New York (SDNY) planned to release a public press release and establish a victim hotline (800 number) following the arrest.
The FBI's Victim Notification System (VNS) and Sentinel system were to be used to compile and manage victim contact information.
The correspondence highlights specific procedural requirements for indexing victims, including the need for guardian information for minors.
Multiple FBI personnel (names redacted) were involved in coordinating victim assistance, indicating a structured, multi-agency response was being organized.
